question: Echo Three to Echo Seven. Han, old buddy, do you read me?
answer: Loud and clear, kid. What's up?

question: Well, I finished my circle. I don't pick up any life readings.
answer: There isn't enough life on this ice cube to fill a space cruiser. The sensors are placed, I'm going back.

question: Right. I'll see you shortly. There's a meteorite that hit the ground near here. I want to check it out. It won't take long. Hey, steady girl. What's the matter? You smell something? Aaargh!
answer: Chewie! All right, don't lose your temper. I'll come right back and give you a hand.

question: Chewie! All right, don't lose your temper. I'll come right back and give you a hand.
answer: Solo?

question: No sign of life out there, General. The sensors are in place. You'll know if anything comes around.
answer: Commander Skywalker reported in yet?

question: No. He's checking out a meteorite that hit near him.
answer: With all the meteor activity in this system, it's going to be difficult to spot approaching ships.

question: General, I've got to leave. I can't stay anymore.
answer: I'm sorry to hear that.

question: Well, there's a price on my head. If I don't pay off Jabba the Hut, I'm a dead man.
answer: A death mark's not an easy thing to live with. You're a good fighter, Solo. I hate to lose you.

question: Thank you, General. Well, Your Highness, I guess this is it.
answer: That's right.

question: Well, don't get all mushy on me. So long, Princess.
answer: Han!

question: Yes, Your Highnessness?
answer: I thought you decided to stay.

question: Well, the bounty hunter we ran into on Ord Mantell changed my mind.
answer: Han, we need you!

question: We?
answer: Yes.

question: Oh, what about you need?
answer: I need? I don't know what you're talking about.

question: You probably don't.
answer: And what precisely am I supposed to know?

question: Come on! You want me to stay because of the way you feel about me.
answer: Yes. You're a great help to us. You're a natural leader...

question: No! That's not it. Come on. Aahhh - uh huh! Come on.
answer: You're imagining things.

question: Am I? Then why are you following me? Afraid I was going to leave without giving you a goodbye kiss?
answer: I'd just as soon kiss a Wookiee.

question: I can arrange that. You could use a good kiss!
answer: Don't try to blame me. I didn't ask you to turn on the thermal heater. I merely commented that it was freezing in the princess' chamber. But it's supposed to be freezing. How are we going to dry out all her clothes? I really don't know. Oh, switch off.

question: Why do you take this apart now? I'm trying to get us out of here and you pull both of these.
answer: Excuse me, sir.

question: Put them back together right now.
answer: Might I have a word with you, please?

question: What do you want?
answer: Well, it's Princess Leia, sir. She's been trying to get you on the communicator.

question: I turned it off. I don't want to talk to her.
answer: Oh. Well, Princess Leia is wondering about Master Luke. He hasn't come back yet. She doesn't know where he is.

question: I don't know where he is.
answer: Nobody knows where he is.

question: What do you mean, "nobody knows"?
answer: Well, uh, you see...

question: Deck Officer. Deck Officer!
answer: Excuse me, sir. Might I inqu...

question: Yes, sir?
answer: Do you know where Commander Skywalker is?

question: I haven't seen him. It's possible he came in through the south entrance.
answer: It's possible? Why don't you go find out? It's getting dark out there.

question: Sir, Commander Skywalker hasn't come in through the south entrance. He might have forgotten to check in.
answer: Not likely. Are the speeders ready?

question: Not yet. We're having some trouble adapting them to the cold.
answer: Then we'll have to go out on Tauntauns.

question: Sir, the temperature's dropping too rapidly.
answer: That's right. And my friends out in it.

question: Your Tauntaun'll freeze before you reach the first marker.
answer: Then I'll see you in hell!

question: Luke... Luke.
answer: Ben?

question: You will go to the Dagobah system.
answer: Dagobah system?

question: There you will learn from Yoda, the Jedi Master who instructed me.
answer: Ben... Ben.

question: Ben... Ben.
answer: Luke! Luke! Don't do this, Luke. Come on, give me a sign here. Not much time.

question: Ben... Ben...
answer: Hang on, kid.

question: Dagobah system...
answer: Whew...

question: Dagobah...
answer: This may smell bad, kid...

question: Yoda...
answer: ...but it will keep you warm... til I get the shelter built. Ooh... I thought they smelled bad on the outside!

question: That's two you owe me, junior. Well your Worship, looks like you managed to keep me around for a little while longer.
answer: I had nothing to do with it. General Rieekan thinks it's dangerous for any ships to leave the system until we've activated the energy shield.

question: That's a good story. I think you just can't bear to let a gorgeous guy like me out of your sight.
answer: I don't know where you get your delusions, laser brain.

question: Laugh it up, fuzzball. But you didn't see us alone in the south passage. She expressed her true feelings for me.
answer: My...! Why, you stuck up,... half- witted... scruffy-looking ...nerf- herder!

question: Who's scruffy-looking? I must have hit pretty close to the mark to get her all riled up like that, huh, kid?
answer: Why, I guess you don't know everything about women yet?

question: Afraid there's not much left.
answer: What was it?

question: Droid of some kind. I didn't hit it that hard. It must have had a self-destruct.
answer: An Imperial probe droid.

question: Admiral.
answer: Yes, Captain

question: I think we've got something, sir. The report is only a fragment from a probe droid in the Hoth system, but it's the best lead we've had.
answer: We have thousands of probe droids searching the galaxy. I want proof, not leads!

question: The visuals indicate life readings.
answer: It could mean anything. If we followed every lead...

question: Okay, that's it. Try it... Off! Turn it off! Turn it off! Off!
answer: Well, forget the heavy equipment. There's plenty of time to get the smaller modules on the transports. Thanks. Chewie, take care of yourself, okay?

question: Hi, kid. There's got to be a reason for it. Check it at the other end. Wait a second. You all right?
answer: Yeah.

question: Be careful.
answer: You, too.

question: What is it, General?
answer: My lord, the fleet has moves out of light-speed. Com-Scan has detected an energy field protecting an area around the sixth planet of the Hoth system. The field is strong enough to deflect any bombardment.

question: The Rebels are alerted to our presence. Admiral Ozzel came out of light-speed too close to the system.
answer: He felt surprise was wiser...

question: He is as clumsy as he is stupid. General, prepare your troops for a surface attack.
answer: Yes, my lord.

question: Just like new, Dack. How about you? I know what you mean. Echo station Five-Seven. We're on our way.
answer: The fleet of snowspeeders races above the ice field at full throttle. They accelerate away from the base and head toward the distant walkers.

question: All right, boys, keep tight now. Steady, Dack. Attack pattern delta. Go now!
answer: The cannons mounted on the walker head fire at the speeders. Other walkers loom in the background. Two speeders race away past two of the enormous walkers and bank to the right.

question: All right, I'm coming in. Hobbie, you still with me?
answer: Two speeders race directly at the head of a walker, then split and fly past it. A speeder banks through and away from the legs of a walker. Two other speeders pass the first speeder from the opposite direction. Other Rebel craft race just above the icy plain.

question: That armor's too strong for blasters. Rogue Group, use your harpoons and tow cables. Go for the legs. It might be our only chance of stopping them. All right, stand by, Dack. Just hang on. Hang on, Dack. Get ready to fire that tow cable.
answer: Rogue Leader and another snowspeeder fly in tight formation toward the walker as explosions burst all around them.

question: Dack? Dack!
answer: Two walkers lumber toward the Rebel base as a speeder between them explodes in a ball of flames.

question: Rogue Three.
answer: Copy, Rogue Leader

question: Wedge, I've lost my gunner. You'll have to make this shot. I'll cover for you. Set your harpoon. Follow me on the next pass.
answer: Coming around, Rogue Leader.

question: Wedge's speeder races through the legs of one of the monstrous walkers.
answer: Activate harpoon.

question: The harpoon hurtles toward the walker, In an instant it is embedded in one of the walker's legs.
answer: Good shot, Janson.

question: The speeder Rogue Three races around one of the giant walker's feet, trailing the cable behind it. Continuing around the back foot, Rogue Three then circles the walker around the tail end.
answer: One more pass.

question: The speeder sweeps left to right in front of the giant legs, towing the cable behind it.
answer: Detach cable.

question: The speeder zooms away into the distance. The tangled legs of the enormous war machine attempt a step, but as they do the giant Imperial walker begins to topple. It teeters for a moment, and then crashes onto the icy ground, sending snow and metal pieces flying.
answer: Whooha! That got him!

question: You all right?
answer: Why are you still here?

question: I heard the command center had been hit.
answer: You got your clearance to leave.

question: Transport, this is Solo. Better take off - I can't get to you. I'll get the princess out on the Falcon.
answer: But... but... but... where are you going? Uh... come back!! Wait! Wait for me! Wait! Stop! How typical.

question: Come on. Hurry up, goldenrod, or you're going to be a permanent resident!
answer: Wait! Wait!

question: Asteroids!
answer: Oh, no! Chewie, set two-seven- one.

question: What are you doing? You're not actually going into an asteroid field?
answer: They'd be crazy to follow us, wouldn't they?

question: I'm going to shut down everything but the emergency power systems.
answer: Sir, I'm almost afraid to ask, but... does that include shutting me down, too?

question: No, I need you to talk to the Falcon, find out what's wrong with the hyperdrive.
answer: Sir, it's quite possible this asteroid is not entirely stable.

question: Not entirely stable? I'm glad you're here to tell us these things. Chewie, take the professor in the back and plug him into the hyperdrive.
answer: Oh! Sometimes I just don't understand human behavior. After all, I'm only trying to do my job in the most...

question: Let go.
answer: Sshh!

question: Let go, please.
answer: Don't get excited.

question: Captain, being held by you isn't quite enough to get me excited.
answer: Sorry, sweetheart. We haven't got time for anything else.

question: Ready for some power? Okay. Let's see now. Put that in there. There you go. Now all I have to do is find this Yoda... if he even exists. Still... there's something familiar about this place. I feel like... I don't know... Like we're being watched!
answer: Away with your weapon! I mean you no harm. I am wondering, why are you here?

question: I'm looking for someone.
answer: Looking? Found someone, you have, I would say, hmmm?

question: Right.
answer: Help you I can. Yes, mmmm.

question: I don't think so. I'm looking for a great warrior.
answer: Ahhh! A great warrior. Wars not make one great.

question: Put that down. Hey! That's my dinner!
answer: How you get so big, eating food of this kind?

question: Listen, friend, we didn't mean to land in that puddle, and if we could get our ship out, we would, but we can't, so why don't you just...
answer: Aww, cannot get your ship out?

question: Hey, you could have broken this. Don't do that. Ohhh... you're making a mess. Hey, give me that!
answer: Mine! Or I will help you not.

question: I don't want your help. I want my lamp back. I'll need it to get out of this slimy mudhole.
answer: Mudhole? Slimy? My home this is. Ah, ah, ah!

question: Oh, Artoo, let him have it!
answer: Mine! Mine!

question: Artoo!
answer: Mine! Mine!

question: Now will you move along, little fella? We're got a lot of work to do.
answer: No! No, no! Stay and help you, I will. Find your friend, hmm?

question: I'm not looking for a friend. I'm looking for a Jedi Master.
answer: Oohhh. Jedi Master. Yoda. You seek Yoda.

question: You know him?
answer: Mmm. Take you to him, I will. Yes, yes. But now, we must eat. Come. Good food. Come. Come, come.

question: Well, of course I'll have to replace it. Here! And Chewie... ... I think we'd better replace the negative power coupling. Hey, Your Worship, I'm only trying to help.
answer: Would you please stop calling me that?

question: Sure, Leia.
answer: Oh, you make it so difficult sometimes.

question: I do, I really do. You could be a little nicer, though. Come on, admit it. Sometimes you think I'm all right.
answer: Occasionally... ... when you aren't acting like a scoundrel.

question: Scoundrel? Scoundrel? I like the sound of that.
answer: Stop that.

question: Stop what?
answer: Stop that! My hands are dirty.

question: My hands are dirty, too. What are you afraid of?
answer: Afraid?

question: You're trembling.
answer: I'm not trembling.

question: You like me because I'm a scoundrel. There aren't enough scoundrels in your life.
answer: I happen to like nice men.

question: I'm a nice man.
answer: No, you're not. You're...

question: No, Captain, they're alive. I want every ship available to sweep the asteroid field until they are found.
answer: Lord Vader.

question: Yes, Admiral, what is it?
answer: The Emperor commands you make contact with him.

question: Move the ship out of the asteroid field so that we can send a clear transmission.
answer: Yes, my lord.

question: What is thy bidding, my master?
answer: There is a great disturbance in the Force.

question: I have felt it.
answer: We have a new enemy - Luke Skywalker.

question: Yes, my master.
answer: He could destroy us.

question: He's just a boy. Obi-Wan can no longer help him.
answer: The Force is strong with him. The son of Skywalker must not become a Jedi.

question: If he could be turned, he would become a powerful ally.
answer: Yes. Yes. He would be a great asset. Can it be done?

question: Look, I'm sure it's delicious. I just don't understand why we can't see Yoda now.
answer: Patience! For the Jedi it is time to eat as well. Eat, eat. Hot. Good food, hm? Good, hmm?

question: How far away is Yoda? Will it take us long to get there?
answer: Not far. Yoda not far. Patience. Soon you will be with him. Rootleaf, I cook. Why wish you become Jedi? Hm?

question: Mostly because of my father, I guess.
answer: Ah, your father. Powerful Jedi was he, powerful Jedi, mmm.

question: Oh, come on. How could you know my father? You don't even know who I am. Oh, I don't know what I'm doing here. We're wasting our time.
answer: I cannot teach him. The boy has no patience.

question: Hmmm. Much anger in him, like his father. Hah. He is not ready.
answer: Yoda! I am ready. I... Ben! I can be a Jedi. Ben, tell him I'm ready.

question: Ready, are you? What know you of ready? For eight hundred years have I trained Jedi. My own counsel will I keep on who is to be trained! A Jedi must have the deepest commitment, the most serious mind. This one a long time have I watched. All his life has he looked away... to the future, to the horizon. Never his mind on where he was. Hmm? What he was doing. Hmph. Adventure. Heh! Excitement. Heh! A Jedi craves not these things. You are reckless! He is too old. Yes, too old to begin the training.
answer: But I've learned so much.

question: Will he finished what he begins?
answer: I won't fail you - I'm not afraid.

question: This ground sure feels strange. It doesn't feel like rock at all.
answer: There's an awful lot of moisture in here.

question: I don't know. I have a bad feeling about this.
answer: Yeah. Watch out! Yeah, that's what I thought. Mynock. Chewie, check the rest of the ship, make sure there aren't any more attached. They're chewing on the power cables.

question: Mynocks?
answer: Go on inside. We'll clean them off if there are any more.

question: Wait a minute... All right, Chewie, let's get out of here!
answer: The Empire is still out there. I don't think it's wise to...

question: No time to discuss this in committee.
answer: I am not a committee! You can't make the jump to light- speed in this asteroid field...

question: Run! Yes. A Jedi's strength flows from the Force. But beware of the dark side. Anger... fear... aggression. The dark side of the Force are they. Easily they flow, quick to join you in a fight. If once you start down the dark path, forever will it dominate your destiny, consume you it will, as it did Obi-Wan's apprentice.
answer: Vader. Is the dark side stronger?

question: No... no... no. Quicker, easier, more seductive.
answer: But how am I to know the good side from the bad?

question: You will know. When you are calm, at peace. Passive. A Jedi uses the Force for knowledge and defense, never for attack.
answer: But tell me why I can't...

question: No, no, there is no why. Nothing more will I teach you today. Clear your mind of questions. Mmm. Mmmmmmmm.
answer: There's something not right here. I feel cold, death.

question: That place... is strong with the dark side of the Force. A domain of evil it is. In you must go.
answer: What's in there?

question: Use the Force. Yes... Now... the stone. Feel it. Concentrate!
answer: Oh, no. We'll never get it out now.

question: So certain are you. Always with you it cannot be done. Hear you nothing that I say?
answer: Master, moving stones around is one thing. This is totally different.

question: No! No different! Only different in your mind. You must unlearn what you have learned.
answer: All right, I'll give it a try.

question: No! Try not. Do. Or do not. There is no try.
answer: I can't. It's too big.

question: Size matters not. Look at me. Judge me by my size, do you? Hm? Mmmm. And well you should not. For my ally in the Force. And a powerful ally it is. Life creates it, makes it grow. Its energy surrounds us and binds us. Luminous beings are we... ... not this crude matter. You must feel the Force around you. Here, between you... me... the tree... the rock... everywhere! Yes, even between this land and that ship!
answer: You want the impossible. I don't... I don't believe it.

question: Apology accepted, Captain Needa.
answer: Lord Vader, our ships have completed their scan of the area and found nothing. If the Millennium Falcon went into light- speed, it'll be on the other side of the galaxy by now.

question: Alert all commands. Calculate every possible destination along their last know trajectory.
answer: Yes, my lord. We'll find them.

question: Don't fail me again, Admiral.
answer: Alert all commands. Deploy the fleet.

question: Thank you.
answer: What did you have in mind for your next move?

question: Well, if they follow standard Imperial procedure, they'll dump their garbage before they go to light-speed, then we just float away.
answer: With the rest of the garbage. Then what?

question: Then we've got to find a safe port somewhere around here. Got any ideas?
answer: No. Where are we?

question: The Anoat system.
answer: Anoat system. There's not much there.

question: No. Well, wait. This is interesting. Lando.
answer: Lando system?

question: Lando's not a system, he's a man. Lando Calrissian. He's a card player, gambler, scoundrel. You'd like him.
answer: Thanks.

question: Bespin. It's pretty far, but I think we can make it.
answer: A mining colony?

question: Yeah, a Tibanna gas mine. Lando conned somebody out of it. We go back a long way, Lando and me.
answer: Can you trust him?

question: No. But he has no love for the Empire, I can tell you that. Here we go, Chewie. Stand by. Detach!
answer: You do have your moments. Not many, but you have them.

question: Concentrate... feel the Force flow. Yes. Good. Calm, yes. Through the Force, things you will see. Other places. The future... the past. Old friends long gone.
answer: Han! Leia!

question: Hmm. Control, control. You must learn control.
answer: I saw... I saw a city in the clouds.

question: Mmm. Friends you have there.
answer: They were in pain.

question: It is the future you see.
answer: Future? Will they die?

question: Difficult to see. Always in motion is the future.
answer: I've got to go to them.

question: What are you doing here?
answer: Ahh... repairs. I thought you could help me out.

question: What have you done to my ship?
answer: Your ship? Hey, remember, you lost her to me fair and square.

question: What's wrong with the Falcon?
answer: Hyperdrive.

question: I'll get my people to work on it.
answer: Good.

question: How's the gas mine? Is it paying off for you?
answer: Oh, not as well as I'd like. We're a small outpost and not very self-sufficient. And I've had supply problems of every kind. I've had labor difficulties... What's so funny?

question: You. Listen to you - you sound like a businessman, a responsible leader. Who'd have thought that, huh?
answer: You know, seeing you sure brings back a few things.

question: Yeah.
answer: Yeah. I'm responsible these days. It's the price you pay for being successful.

question: But I've learned so much since then. Master Yoda, I promise to return and finish what I've begun. You have my word.
answer: It is you and your abilities the Emperor wants. that is why your friends are made to suffer.

question: And that is why I have to go.
answer: Luke, I don't want to lose you to the Emperor the way I lost Vader.

question: The ship is almost finished. Two or Three more things and we're in great shape.
answer: The sooner the better. Something's wrong here. No one has seen or knows anything about Threepio. He's been gone too long to have gotten lost.

question: Relax. I'll talk to Lando and see what I can find out.
answer: I don't trust Lando.

question: Well, I don't trust him, either. But he is my friend. Besides, we'll soon be gone.
answer: And then you're as good as gone, aren't you? What happened?

question: Where? Found him in a junk pile?
answer: Oh, what a mess. Chewie, do you think you can repair him?

question: Lando's got people who can fix him.
answer: No, thanks.

question: No, thanks.
answer: I'm sorry. Am I interrupting anything?

question: Not really.
answer: You look absolutely beautiful. You truly belong here with us among the clouds.

question: Thank you.
answer: Will you join me for a little refreshment? Everyone's invited, of course. Having trouble with you droid?

question: Lord Vader.
answer: You may take Captain Solo to Jabba the Hut after I have Skywalker. He will not be permanently damaged.

question: Lord Vader, what about Leia and the Wookiee?
answer: They must never again leave this city.

question: That was never a condition of our agreement, nor was giving Han to this bounty hunter!
answer: Perhaps you think you're being treated unfairly.

question: No.
answer: Good. It would be unfortunate if I had to leave a garrison here.

question: I feel terrible.
answer: Why are they doing this?

question: They never even asked me any questions.
answer: Lando.

question: They'll have to stay here, but at least they'll be safe.
answer: What about Han?

question: Vader's giving him to the bounty hunter.
answer: Vader wants us all dead.

question: Well, Calrissian, did he survive?
answer: Yes, he's alive. And in perfect hibernation.

question: He's all yours bounty hunter. Reset the chamber for Skywalker. Good. See to it that he finds his way here. Calrissian, take the princess and the Wookiee to my ship.
answer: You said they'd be left in the city under my supervision.

question: Oh, so we understand, don't we, Chewie? He had no choice.
answer: I'm just trying to help...

question: We don't need any of your help.
answer: H-a-a-a...

question: You have learned much, young one.
answer: You'll find I'm full of surprises.

question: Your destiny lies with me, Skywalker. Obi-Wan knew this to be true.
answer: No!

question: You are beaten. It is useless to resist. Don't let yourself be destroyed as Obi-Wan did. There is no escape. Don't make me destroy you. You do not yet realize your importance. You have only begun to discover your power. Join me and I will complete your training. With our combined strength, we can end this destructive conflict and bring order to the galaxy.
answer: I'll never join you!

question: If you only knew the power of the dark side. Obi-Wan never told you what happened to your father.
answer: He told me enough! It was you who killed him.

question: No. I am your father.
answer: No. No. That's not true! That's impossible!

question: Search your feelings. You know it to be true.
answer: No! No! No!

question: Luke. You can destroy the Emperor. He has foreseen this. It is your destiny. Join me, and together we can rule the galaxy as father and son. Come with me. It is the only way.
answer: Ben... Ben, please! Ben. Leia! Hear me! Leia!

question: Luke... We've got to go back.
answer: What?

question: I know where Luke is.
answer: But what about those fighter?

question: Chewie, just do it.
answer: But what about Vader? All right, all right, all right.

question: It's Luke. Chewie, slow down. Slow down and we'll get under him. Lando, open the top hatch.
answer: Out the cockpit window, Leia sees Luke falling from the bottom of the city. The ship gains on him.

question: Okay. Easy, Chewie.
answer: Flak bursts all around it as the Falcon banks away from the city. Leia and Chewie struggle with the controls.

question: They'll be in range of our tractor beam in moments, my lord.
answer: Did your men deactivate the hyperdrive on the Millennium Falcon?

question: Yes, my lord.
answer: Good. Prepare the boarding party and set your weapons for stun.
